    Palettes for divergent scale

    palette_div.Rd

    Palette for a divergent scale, with the following palettes:

    - arcane: 5 colors, inspired by the animation Arcane.
    - casa_de_papel: 7 colors, inspired by the TV series La Casa de Papel.
    - deadly_class: 6 colors, inspired by the TV series Deadly Class.
    - dexter: 6 colors, inspired by the TV series Dexter.
    - godzilla_vs_kong: 9 colors, inspired by the movie Godzilla vs Kong.
    - good_place: X colors, inspired by the TV series The Good Place.
    - homeland: 9 colors, inspired by the TV series Homeland.
    - laura_dean: 8 colors, inspired by the graphic novel Laura Dean Keeps Breaking Up with Me.
    - racionais: 7 colors, inspired by the CD cover 'Nada Como Um Dia Após o Outro Dia' of the brazilian rap group Racionais MC's.
    - sandman: 5 colors, inspired by the graphic novel Sandman.
    - svott_pilgrim: 6 colors, inspired by the movie Scott Pilgrim vs the World.
    - the_americans: 7 colors, inspired by the TV series The Americans.
    - the_expanse: 8 colors, inspired by the TV series The Expanse.
    - vox_machina: 7 colors, inspired by the animation The Legend of Vox Machina.
    - wanda_vision: 9 colors, inspired by the TV series WandaVision.
    - white_lotus: 8 colors, inspired by the TV series The White Lotus.

    Usage

    palette_div(
  name = c("arcane", "casa_de_papel", "deadly_class", "dexter", "godzilla_vs_kong",
    "good_place", "homeland", "laura_dean", "racionais", "sandman", "scott_pilgrim",
    "the_americans", "the_expanse", "vox_machina", "wanda_vision", "white_lotus"),
  reverse = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    name

    A character single value, that is the pallete name

    reverse

    A boolean value, if TRUE the function will reverse the pallete order (default = FALSE)

    Value

    A character vector with the colors hex codes.

    Examples

    
palette_example(palette = palette_div(name = "sandman"))
